title: bruges
author: bruges
content: IRON FISHIron Fish encrypts every transaction, shielding your sensitive asset information from public view. With read-only view keys, you remain compliant and in control.The Iron Fish mainnet launched April 20, 2023. You can read more about it here.-WEBSITEhttps://ironfish.network/-DISCORDhttps://discord.ironfish.network/-TWITTER / Xhttps://twitter.com/ironfishcrypto-TELEGRAMhttps://t.me/ironfishcryptochat-GITHUBhttps://github.com/iron-fish-BLOGhttps://ironfish.network/learn/blog-WALLETSCLI Node and Wallet: https://ironfish.network/use/get-started/installationGUI Node and Wallet: https://ironfish.network/use/node-appFoxwallet (mobile 3rd party): https://foxwallet.com-TOKENOMICShttps://ironfish.network/learn/tokenomicshttps://cryptorank.io/price/iron-fish/vestingIron Fish Funding Rounds: $5.3M - 06 Apr, 2021, $27.6M - 30 Nov, 2021.Top Investors: Andreessen Horowitz (a16z), Sequoia Capital.-

comments.author: bruges
comments.body: Iron Fish v1.12.0 has been released!## Notable Changesâ€‹Removing support for NodeJS v16; adding support for NodeJS v20 and beyond. The node now requires a minimum version of NodeJS v18 instead of _only_ NodeJS v18, so we can more easily support new NodeJS versions as they are released.â€‹Block syncing speed should be improved. The node will regularly measure the connection of some peers to try to find a faster peer to sync from. The first time this occurs is 2 minutes after the node starts syncing, then 4, 8, 16.. up to a maximum of once per 60 minutes.â€‹Nodes should be able to find peers faster and more consistently. â€‹Added a `keepOpenPeerSlot` config option (default false). When set to true, a node will disconnect from a peer if it is at maxPeers, so that the node will always allow an incoming connection instead of reaching the maximum number of peers and rejecting incoming connections.https://github.com/iron-fish/ironfish/releases/tag/v1.12.0

comments.author: jacafbiz
comments.body: This is a very good project, but recently people seem not to care about privacy again looking at the success of Worldcoin and Arkham intelligence, I have added this project to my watchlist and will try to research more about it, my main concern now is the burn rate for the project, if the team still have money to spend on the development of the project because they need to keep developing the platform just to attractsÂ  investors interest

Only hope for this 1 is a pump and dump and it will be forgotten in history. They couldn't even do a fully functioning wallet on network release being VC funded. Had to start with CLI.

comments.author: GlacierBIT
comments.body: Quote from: MMOStars on November 18, 2023, 11:24:45 PMQuote from: jacafbiz on November 18, 2023, 06:45:09 PMThis is a very good project, but recently people seem not to care about privacy again looking at the success of Worldcoin and Arkham intelligence, I have added this project to my watchlist and will try to research more about it, my main concern now is the burn rate for the project, if the team still have money to spend on the development of the project because they need to keep developing the platform just to attractsÂ  investors interestNobody cares, this is same as chia with premine bags for owners devs, airdrop on release. Only hope for this 1 is a pump and dump and it will be forgotten in history. They couldn't even do a fully functioning wallet on network release being VC funded. Had to start with CLI. Perhaps they have reconsidered their development tactics. Maybe creating a wallet on network was not a priority. The plans of the developers of such projects change very quickly, so do not forget about them if your interests do not coincide.

comments.author: bruges
comments.created_time: November 19, 2023, 02:48:53 PMLast edit: November 19, 2023, 04:32:38 PM by bruges
comments.body: At the moment both CLI and GUI wallets works well. But the wallets are full nodes, so you need to sync the blockchain before you can start using it.From pure speculative point of view, seed investors bought 4.11M coins for $5.3M, that's $1.28 per coin. Horowitz and Sequoia bought 6.17M coins for $27.6M, that's $4.47. And current price is around $1.33. So, this is rather rare opportunity to buy the coins cheaper than Horowitz and Sequoia. Anything below $5 looks like a great price to invest.Also excited about the upcoming PoW algorithm change, to make it more GPU friendly. As there are no much profitable GPU coins nowadays, this can bring attention from mining community. Lolliedieb is working on it, the developer of lolminer software. So Ironfish team definitely have cash to continue the development of the project.

Just because someone wasted their money on this nonsense from VCs doesnt mean that others should be rushing to invest in this when this chain literally has nothing to offer. There is monero, dero, firo and dozens of other that literally have no innovation in them besides having privacy as their layer1 usage.

comments.author: bruges
comments.body: Iron Fish v1.13.0 has been released!What's Changed* Updated the SDK to now run on Node 20 LTS https://github.com/iron-fish/ironfish/pull/4434* Added sorting for peers command https://github.com/iron-fish/ironfish/pull/4442* Whitelisted nodes are now not disconnected https://github.com/iron-fish/ironfish/pull/4444* Adding ability to select notes in the transaction send command by https://github.com/iron-fish/ironfish/pull/4465Note Selection in 'ironfish wallet:send' You can now pass note hashes to `ironfish wallet:send` command to force the wallet to use these notes in the transaction.ExampleCode:ironfish wallet:send \Â  Â  --note 72e91d6672d79f9006f128a16cf52bbb585037fee2aea8385b56919c3ac9570b \Â  Â  --note 4a5feb193d425fa73abfb108027a643eb027e46684c50e2bef5d66ea48ec3d2d \Â  Â  --note f8b91f81caf4489c83734c2b29ad4587c9ba0c1080854a3f6da19f6fad49265eNOTE: If you specify notes, and it's not enough for the send amount, the wallet will add extra notes to fund the transaction.

comments.author: Miles2006
comments.body: The way new coins are coming to the ecosystem is getting worried because most of them are not coming to the industry for the good of the people but to scam them and run away. If really they have good intention then they would have invested the money used in building the coins to in bitcoin to have interest. Many of them have fallen while some are still struggling in the ecospace. most of them will end up as a platform to money laundering.

comments.author: biggatoshi
comments.body: How is IRON doing?Â  I have not heard much since the launch.

comments.author: bruges
comments.body: Quote from: biggatoshi on December 06, 2023, 07:50:19 PMHow is IRON doing?Â  I have not heard much since the launch.Â  They constantly improving their node and wallet, still several issues needed to be fixed.Next major thing is algo change. Lolliedieb is working on new GPU friendly algo. It seems it will be soon started tested on testnet.In terms of price, IRON bottomed around $0.5 and started recovering.

comments.author: bruges
comments.body: In today's monthly dev call they were talking about bridges, official mobile wallet and ambassador program.Bridges. They are discussing technical details with several bridge operators to bring support to Ironfish. They mentioned 3 of them and provided ETA Q3 2024.Official mobile wallet. Despite the fact that there is already Foxwallet mobile wallet, they want to create an official one. The work just started, no ETA provided.Ambassador program. They are going to hire ambassadors for the project. As I understand this is a step towards marketing campaign. Pretty cool. Besides the above, they were talking about the work happening on node and wallet, bug fixes and SDK code refactoring.https://youtube.com/watch?v=Q95-aLh-3gs

comments.author: bruges
comments.body: AMA with Elena, hosted by Bitrue.Elena spoke of various subjects such as importance of privacy, grants, upcoming developments, hard forks, why POW instead of POS, Open-source contributions, Node app etc.https://twitter.com/i/spaces/1OwGWYgrOYjxQ

comments.author: bruges
comments.body: ðŸ“£Â  Iron Fish v1.14.0 has been released!Here are some of the major changes:* Sending a transaction in the CLI now shows a summary of the transaction, including spends and outputs, before sending it. ðŸ™Œ * We now display a clearer error when passing --path and an invalid argument to the wallet:import command.* The `wallet/getAccountsStatus` RPC now returns whether an account is view-only, and we added `wallet/getAccountStatus` for fetching a single account's status. There are some breaking changes to these RPCs, so please see the release notes below.* The `peer/addPeer` RPC now waits for the node to connect to the peer before returning.* Fixed a time-related case where snapshot downloads could unexpectedly time out.Here are the full release notes: https://github.com/iron-fish/ironfish/releases/tag/v1.14.0

comments.author: bruges
comments.body: Several recent updates:1. Plans to incorporate new mining algo code into node software in the first week of January 2024, so anyone can start testing it.2. Node release with new command added 'ironfish wallet:notes:combine', this helps to workaround an issue with stuck transactions on wallets with lots of small inputs.3. Plans for an official mobile wallet in Q1 2024.

comments.author: bruges
comments.body: You can trade Ironfish on MEXC now!https://www.mexc.com/exchange/IRON_USDT
